dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4868 IH: Member Business Loan Expansion Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Vicente Gonzalez of Texas (for himself and Mr. Fitzpatrick) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Credit Union Act to provide more loan flexibility to credit unions, to amend the Federal Home Loan Bank Act to expand homeownership access, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Member Business Loan Expansion Act.

section.header: Flexibility for NCUA Board to increase Federal credit union loan maturities
section.text: Section 107(5) of the Federal Credit Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1757(5)) is amended by inserting after shall not exceed 15 years the following: (or such longer maturity as the Board may allow, by regulation).
Section 107A(c)(1)(B)(iii) of the Federal Credit Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1757a(c)(1)(B)(iii)) is amended by striking $50,000 and inserting $100,000.

section.header: Expanding homeownership access through community financial institutions
section.text: Section 2(10)(A) of the Federal Home Loan Bank Act (12 U.S.C. 1422(10)(A)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in clause (i), by inserting after Federal Deposit Insurance Act the following or Federal Credit Union Act; and
in clause (ii), by striking $1,000,000,000 and inserting $10,000,000,000.
